climbs.name: Toxic Avenger
climbs.fa: Tai DeVore, Jeremy Freeman, Erik Erickson

content.description: Start to the right of finger crackin good on the arete of the slab. There are two bolts, head up the low angle cracks to another bolt and then clip another bolt at the bottom of the roof, pull the roof and pass two more bolts.
content.protection: 6 bolts, small gear, maybe a 2" cam.

climbs.name: Seams to Be
climbs.fa: Darrell Hensel, Tai DeVore, Doug Tomczik

content.description: Follow a thin seam up the slab. Fantastic slab climbing at its best and most desperate. The guidebook gives it 12a but it seemed a lot harder than that for Pine Creek; more in line with an old school Idyllwild 12a slab, albeit with closer bolting.
content.location: Center of Super Fun Site. The most striking bolted line in the middle of the big slab.

climbs.name: Not What It Seams
climbs.fa: Darrell Hensel , Tai DeVore, Doug Tomczik - 12/13

content.description:
Start as for Gate Keeper.  Positive holds past a few bolts.  At the small roof feature move left for the friction crux.  After the crux head up to the obvious left trending seam.  Follow the seam to the anchor that is shared with Seams To Be.

Not quite as clean feeling as Seams To Be, but the upper seam is pretty good.

It is possible to avoid the friction crux by stepping right at the small roof feature and climbing the Gate Keeper arete for ~15 feet before stepping back left to the bolted line.  11 something overall this way.
content.protection: 11 bolts, shared mussy anchor with Seams To Be.
content.location: Starts with the first few moves of Gate Keeper, then moves onto the bolted face just to the left.

content.description: Climbs the obvious slightly right leaning seam/dihedral feature just right of Atom Smasher.  The upper dihedral is a little deceiving, what looks like it may be thin crack ends up being yet another techy Pine Creek face seam.
content.location: Bolted seam/shallow dihedral right of Atom Smasher, left of Ground Zero.  Scamble to the start of Ground Zero.  There is a single ring belay bolt, belaying here reduces the amount of rope that would be in the system if starting from the ground proper.

content.description: First bolted line to the right of the wide chimney. It climbs an interesting looking blank groove.  A definitive crux section mid-way leads to easier featured climbing to the anchor. Beautiful line, great movement.
content.location: First bolted line to the right of the big gully.

climbs.name: Gate Keeper
climbs.fa: Tai DeVore, Jeremy Freeman, Adam Winters, Greg Smith, 2009

content.description:
pitch 1, 5.9: Start up blocks directly below the crackline, entering the crack after ~3 meters. Follow the crack, stepping right between systems at about 15 meters height. The pitch ends at a bolt anchor (rap rings).

pitch 2, 5.9: Move up and left to a right facing corner, climb this to a small roof, pull the roof then move up and left to an anchor.

Rappel descent: two 35m rappels (probably doable with 60m rope, but be very careful on the second rappel, it may involve some downclimbing).
content.location: The obvious crackline in the middle of slab at the back/center of the area.

content.description: Scramble up to a right facing corner, climb up to the roof and pull left around it. Continue up the crack to lower-off anchor.
Climb a thin flake to a nice stance and follow the bolt line trending right, pull through a section of vertical climbing on crimps to finish up another thin flake.
content.location: Second partially  bolted line to the right of the big gully.
